metadata.feature_description: Search pages with multiple filters including page type, tags, publish status, date range, and workflow

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages and click search icon
steps.expected: Page Search Results view should open with Advanced Filters section
steps.actual: Page Search Results view opened with Advanced Filters section visible

steps.action: Expand Advanced Filters and click Page Type dropdown
steps.expected: Dropdown should show page type options
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed options: Standard, Existing, URL, File

steps.expected: Results should filter to show only standard pages
steps.actual: Results filtered to show 30 standard pages

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Search by page type with empty results (URL)

steps.expected: Results should filter or show empty if no URL pages exist
steps.actual: NO PAGE FOUND message displayed - correctly shows empty results when no URL pages exist

steps.action: Click Publish Status dropdown in Advanced Filters
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed options: All, Published, Draft

steps.expected: Results should filter to show only draft pages
steps.actual: 1 PAGE FOUND - 'Wiki Test' page shown with draft status

steps.action: Click on Published On Date range picker

steps.expected: Results should filter to pages published within date range
steps.actual: 29 PAGES FOUND within the specified date range

steps.action: Apply multiple filters: Page Type=Standard, Publish Status=Published, Date Range=02/01/2026-02/09/2026
steps.expected: Results should be filtered by all criteria combined
steps.actual: 29 PAGES FOUND matching all combined filter criteria

steps.action: Enter 'News' in the search text field and search
steps.expected: Results should filter to pages containing 'News'
steps.actual: 1 PAGE FOUND - page with 'News' in the name displayed

steps.action: Applied URL page type filter which has no matching pages
steps.expected: Empty results should be displayed with appropriate message
steps.actual: NO PAGE FOUND message displayed correctly

observations: Tags filter UI exists in Advanced Filters but no pages in the test environment have tags assigned, so tag filtering could not be meaningfully tested with actual results. The API supports tags parameter.
Workflow filter dropdown exists but all pages in test environment use 'Direct Publish' workflow, limiting meaningful workflow-based filtering tests.
Pagination controls were not visible with current result sets. API supports pageIndex and pageSize parameters for pagination.
The Page Type dropdown options are: Standard, Existing, URL, File - matching the API's pageType parameter capabilities.

Code review confirms SearchPages API at EvoqPagesController.cs supports all filter parameters: searchKey, pageType, tags, publishStatus, publishDateStart, publishDateEnd, workflowId, pageIndex, pageSize
